author: nomenotanyone9264
content: Anyone aware of any other public Eth2 Beacon chain providers other than Infura (and  running a one or your own  ofc)?

author: yorickdowne
content: Now. Or in two years. Eth 2.0 is a marketing meme that includes a host of features: PoS, light clients, sharding, as the most important ones. PoS is live, though not yet merged with PoW. Light clients are going live MoreSoonerish(tm). Sharding ... two years is my most optimistic guess.

author: yorickdowne
content:
Nope. Given how lightweight the consensus client (beacon) is, though - easy enough to run one yourself.
If using the Infura beacon, you'll want to run a Teku validator with `--validators-early-attestations-enabled=false`, which should be available with tomorrow's release.

author: nomenotanyone9264
content: What's the reason for running with that flag, would infura ditch the message as it's early or would it send it on and potentially cause a slashing?

author: yorickdowne
content: Suggest taking the client talk to the Consensys/teku Discord. Briefly, with a load-balanced consensus client / beacon like Infura, with the default behavior of attesting early, "you can easily get the event indicating a block is available from one server but then wind up actually creating the attestation from a server that doesnâ€™t have it yet. So you wind up with the wrong head vote. That reduces your reward in itself but also makes it more likely your attestation wonâ€™t make it onto the chain at all since it doesnâ€™t get included in aggregates etc. ". In our testing it cut rewards in roughly half over a 24-hour period.
